sect2.title: Introduction to OpenLDAP
sect2.para: The OpenLDAP package provides an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

sect2.title: Installation of OpenLDAP
sect2.para: Install OpenLDAP by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --libexecdir=/usr/sbin \ --sysconfdir=/etc --localstatedir=/srv/ldap \ --enable-ldbm --disable-debug && make depend && make && make test && make install && chmod 755 /usr/lib/libl*-2.2.so.7.0.6

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --libexecdir=/usr/sbin: Puts the server executables in /usr/sbin instead of /usr/libexec.
--sysconfdir=/etc: Sets the configuration file directory to avoid the default of /usr/etc.
--localstatedir=/srv/ldap: Sets the directory to use for the LDAP directory database, replication logs and run-time variable data.
--enable-ldbm: Build slapd with primary database back end using either Berkeley DB or GNU Database Manager.
make test: Validate correct build of the package. If you've enabled tcp_wrappers, ensure you add 127.0.0.1 to your /etc/hosts.allow file if you have a restrictive /etc/hosts.deny file.
chmod 755 /usr/lib/libl*-2.2.so.7.0.6: This command adds the executable bit to the shared libraries.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Configuring the slapd and slurpd servers can be complex. Securing the LDAP directory, especially if you are storing non-public data such as password databases, can also be a challenging task. You'll need to modify the /etc/openldap/slapd.conf and /etc/openldap/ldap.conf files to set up OpenLDAP for your particular needs.

sect3.title: Utilizing GDBM
sect3.para: To utilize GDBM as the database backend, the database entry in /etc/openldap/slapd.conf must be changed from bdb to ldbm. You can use both by creating an additional database section in /etc/openldap/slapd.conf.

sect3.title: Mozilla Address Directory
sect3.para: By default, LDAPv2 support is disabled in the slapd.conf file. Once the database is properly set up and Mozilla is configured to use the directory, you must add allow bind_v2 to the slapd.conf file.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The OpenLDAP package contains ldapadd, ldapcompare, ldapdelete, ldapmodify, ldapmodrdn, ldappasswd, ldapsearch, ldapwhoami, slapadd, slapcat, slapd, slapdn, slapindex, slappasswd, slaptest, slurpd, liblber and the libldap libraries.

sect3.title: ldapadd
sect3.para: ldapadd opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and adds entries.

sect3.title: ldapcompare
sect3.para: ldapcompare opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and performs a compare using specified parameters.

sect3.title: ldapdelete
sect3.para: ldapdelete opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and deletes one or more entries.

sect3.title: ldapmodify
sect3.para: ldapmodify opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and modifies entries.

sect3.title: ldapmodrdn
sect3.para: ldapmodrdn opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and modifies the RDN of entries.

sect3.title: ldappasswd
sect3.para: ldappasswd is a tool to set the password of an LDAP user.

sect3.title: ldapsearch
sect3.para: ldapsearch opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and performs a search using specified parameters.

sect3.title: ldapwhoami
sect3.para: ldapwhoami opens a connection to an LDAP server, binds and displays whoami information.

sect3.title: slapadd
sect3.para: slapadd is used to add entries specified in LDAP Directory Interchange Format (LDIF) to an LDAP database.

sect3.title: slapcat
sect3.para: slapcat is used to generate an LDAP LDIF output based upon the contents of a slapd database.

sect3.title: slapd
sect3.para: slapd is the stand-alone LDAP server.

sect3.title: slapdn
sect3.para: slapdn checks a list of string-represented DNs based on schema syntax.

sect3.title: slapindex
sect3.para: slapindex is used to regenerate slapd indices based upon the current contents of a database.

sect3.title: slappasswd
sect3.para: slappasswd is an OpenLDAP password utility.

sect3.title: slaptest
sect3.para: slaptest checks the sanity of the slapd.conf file.

sect3.title: slurpd
sect3.para: slurpd is the stand-alone LDAP replication server.

sect3.title: liblber and libldap
sect3.para: These libraries support the LDAP programs and provide functionality for other programs interacting with LDAP.
